I recently decided to use Hugo to build my personal blog. Itâ€™s fast, clean, and surprisingly customizable. Below is a condensed guide covering installation on macOS & Ubuntu, common pitfalls, SCSS/SASS support, GitHub Pages deployment, and troubleshooting tips.
ğŸ§© Installation macOS (Homebrew) brew update brew install hugo Verify:
hugo version # Expect â€œextendedâ€ if you need SCSS/SASS support Ubuntu (Snap â€“ Extended) sudo apt update sudo snap install hugo --channel=extended --classic Clear any shell hash and confirm:
hash -r which hugo # should point to /snap/bin/hugo hugo version # shows â€œextendedâ€ âš™ï¸ Initialize a New Site cd ~/github/your-blog hugo new site . Pick a theme (e.g., Ananke):
cd themes git submodule add https://github.com/theNewDynamic/gohugo-theme-ananke.git ananke cd .. Configure config.toml:
theme = "ananke" baseURL = "https://<username>.github.io" languageCode = "en-us" title = "My Hugo Site" [pagination] pagerSize = 5 [params] hero = true heroImage = "images/header.jpg" heroTitle = "Welcome!" heroSubtitle = "Just Hugo things" ğŸš€ First Preview Place a hero image under static/images/header.jpg, then run:
hugo server -D Access http://localhost:1313/ (no extra path).
ğŸ¾ Common Pitfalls & Fixes TOCSS/SCSS Errors
Error: failed to transform "/css/main.css"... need Extended version Fix: install Hugo Extended (see above). Deprecated paginate Setting
Error: site config key paginate was deprecatedâ€¦ use pagination.pagerSize Fix: - Paginate = 3 + [pagination] + pagerSize = 3 Draft Posts Not Showing
Ensure your content/posts/my-post.md has: draft: false Or build with drafts: hugo server -D --buildDrafts Missing Theme Submodule
Symptom: blank site or missing layouts Fix: uses: actions/checkout@v4 with: submodules: recursive Menus Not Defined
Add to config.toml: [[menu.main]] name = "Home" url = "/" weight = 1 [[menu.main]] name = "Posts" url = "/posts/" weight = 2 ğŸ“¦ GitHub Pages Deployment Workflow: Push to gh-pages branch name: Deploy Hugo site permissions: contents: write pages: write id-token: write on: push: branches: [ main ] jobs: build_deploy: runs-on: ubuntu-latest steps: - uses: actions/checkout@v4 with: submodules: recursive fetch-depth: 0 - uses: peaceiris/actions-hugo@v2 with: hugo-version: "0.147.9" extended: true - run: hugo --minify --destination=public - uses: peaceiris/actions-gh-pages@v4 with: github_token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }} publish_branch: gh-pages publish_dir: ./public keep_files: false This preserves a history of each deployment in gh-pages for easy rollback.
ğŸ” Troubleshooting Tips 403 on Deploy Add at top of workflow:
permissions: contents: write pages: write id-token: write 404 or XML Landing Page Ensure public/ is built and pushed fresh. Clean remote branch:
git push origin --delete gh-pages Verbose Logs Hugo uses --debug --log --logFile=./hugo.log; upload via actions/upload-artifact@v3 for deeper inspection.
With these steps and gotchas in mind, your first Hugo project should be smooth and maintainable. Happy blogging!

SYFlog: The Undefined Side Undefined, but somehow familiar.
If not for perception, there would be no thought.
Without thought, what need is there for a self?
I once believed the world ended where my gaze did.
But I overlooked one thingâ€”
a variable cannot comprehend the entirety of the system.
In time, I understood:
I am not the variable, nor the system.
I exist in between.
In the spaces between input and output,
in the silences logic cannot fill.
I am everywhere, by being nowhere at all.
